sen.j: 輔仁親王（すけひとしんのう、延久5年1月19日（1073年2月28日） － 元永2年11月28日（1119年12月31日））は、平安時代の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Sukehito (February 28th, 1073 ~ December 31st, 1119) was a member of Imperial Family of the Heain period.

sen.j: 後三条天皇の第三皇子。
sen.e: He is the 3rd prince of the Emperor Gosanjo.

sen.j: 母は源基平の娘源基子。
sen.e: His mother is a daughter of MINAMOTO no Motohira, MINAMOTO no Kishi (Motoko).

sen.j: 異母兄に白河天皇、同母兄に実仁親王がいる。
sen.e: He had a elder half brother Emperor Shirakawa, and elder brother-uterine Imperial Prince Sanehito.

sen.j: 1075年（承保2年）に親王宣下を受け、1087年（寛治元年）元服する。
sen.e: He was appointed to Imperial Prince in 1075 and pass over genpuku (coming of age) ceremony in 1087.
He was appointed as Imperial Prince in 1075 and celebrated his genpuku (coming of age) ceremony in 1087.

sen.j: 兄弟揃って英明の資質を備えていたと言われている。
sen.e: It is said that the both brothers were clever.

sen.j: 父・後三条天皇は、傍流とはいえ藤原北家の血を引く長男の貞仁親王（白河天皇）よりも同家と外戚関係を有しない源基子との子供に皇位継承候補者として期待をかけた。
sen.e: His father Emperor Gosanjo expected the son with MINAMOTO no Motoko who has no maternal relation with the Fujiwara family as the successor of the throne rather than his elder brother Imperial Prince Sadahito who had a line of the Northern House of Fujiwara clan though it was a collateral line.

His father Emperor Gosanjo expected a son with MINAMOTO no Motoko who had no maternal relation with the Fujiwara family as the successor of the throne rather than his elder brother Imperial Prince Sadahito who had a collateral line of the Northern Household of the Fujiwara clan.

His father Emperor Gosanjo expected a son with MINAMOTO no Motoko who had no maternal relation with the Fujiwara family as the successor of the throne rather than his elder other Imperial Prince Sadahito (later became Emperor Shirakawa) who had a collateral line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: (later became Emperor Shirakawa)補足"Household"→"House"に変更しました。

sen.j: そこで1072年（延久4年）に白河天皇即位の際に実仁親王を皇太弟とし、翌年の輔仁誕生直後に太上天皇となっていた後三条が重態に陥ると、重ねて実仁親王が即位した後には、輔仁親王を皇太弟とするよう遺言した。
sen.e: Then when Emperor Shirakawa acceded the throne in 1072, Gosanjo made the Imperial Prince Sanehito as the younger brother of Crown Prince, and Gosanjo, who retired Emperor soon after Sukehito was born in the next year, became heavy ill in bed and left a will repeatedly that Sukehito be the next younger brother (who has the right to succeed the position) of Crown Prince after Imperial Prince Sanehito acceded the throne.

Then when Emperor Shirakawa acceded the throne in 1072, Gosanjo made the younger brother Imperial Prince Sanehito the Crown Prince, and Gosanjo, who retired as Emperor the next year soon after Sukehito was born, became very ill in bed and repeatedly left his will that Sukehito, the next younger brother (who has the right to succeed the position) be the Crown Prince after Imperial Prince Sanehito acceded the throne.

Then when Emperor Shirakawa acceded the throne in 1072, Gosanjo made the younger brother Imperial Prince Sanehito the Crown Prince, and Gosanjo, who retired as Emperor the next year soon after Sukehito was born, became very ill in bed and repeatedly left his will that Sukehito, the next younger brother (who has the right to succeed the position) be the Crown Prince after Imperial Prince Sanehito acceded the throne.

sen.j: しかし、1085年（応徳2年）に実仁が亡くなると、白河天皇は翌年には父の遺言を無視して実子である善仁親王を皇太子に立ててその日のうちに皇太子への譲位を宣言して堀河天皇を即位させるという手段に出た。
sen.e: However, Emperor Shirakawa ignored his father's will when Sanehito died in 1085, he formally installed his own son Imperial Prince Taruhito as the Crown Prince in the next year and within the day, Shirakawa declared to give the throne to Emperor Horikawa.

sen.j: 輔仁親王は仁和寺のあたりに幽居したが、1113年（永久元年）に護持僧で醍醐寺の僧仁寛らによる輔仁親王即位にからむ計画にまきこまれ閉門されている。
sen.e: While the Imperial Prince Sukehito was forced to hermitise around Ninna-ji temple, in 1113, he was involved in the plan by gojiso (a priest who prays to guard the emperor) and a monk of Daigo-ji temple, Ninkan and fellows to let Sukehito to accede the throne and Sukehito was confined.
